title: How to Rip MP3s from an Audio CD with iTunes

steps.headline: Launch iTunes.
steps.description: Click the iTunes icon in the dock.

steps.headline: Choose "MP3" Encoder from the" Import Using" pop-up menu.
Choose "High Quality" (160 kbps) from the "Setting" pop-up menu.
steps.description: Click OK. This bit rate setting provides the best compromise between quality and file size.

steps.headline: Load an audio CD into your computer.
Clear the check box of any song that you do not want to import from the CD.
steps.description: All songs on the CD have a check box next to their title by default.

steps.headline: Click the "Import CD" button.
steps.description: Your songs will begin to transfer. Once the import is complete, check that the songs have transferred properly. Your MP3 player is now ready with its new set of tunes!

text: Launch iTunes. Click the iTunes icon in the dock. Choose iTunes, then select "Preferences".  Click the "Import Settings" button.  Choose "MP3" Encoder from the" Import Using" pop-up menu.  Choose "High Quality" (160 kbps) from the "Setting" pop-up menu. Click OK. This bit rate setting provides the best compromise between quality and file size. Load an audio CD into your computer.  Clear the check box of any song that you do not want to import from the CD. All songs on the CD have a check box next to their title by default. Click the "Import CD" button. Your songs will begin to transfer. Once the import is complete, check that the songs have transferred properly. Your MP3 player is now ready with its new set of tunes!
sentences: Click the iTunes icon in the dock.
Choose "MP3" Encoder from the" Import Using" pop-up menu.
Choose "High Quality" (160 kbps) from the "Setting" pop-up menu.
This bit rate setting provides the best compromise between quality and file size.
Load an audio CD into your computer.
Clear the check box of any song that you do not want to import from the CD.
All songs on the CD have a check box next to their title by default.
Your songs will begin to transfer.
Once the import is complete, check that the songs have transferred properly.
Your MP3 player is now ready with its new set of tunes!
